intro: Anathallis dolichopus, commonly known as the long-stalked spider orchid, is a species of orchid native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which consists of a single, elongated stem bearing a cluster of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its flowers have a distinctive structure with a narrow, spurred lip that aids in pollination by specific insect species. Anathallis dolichopus is a rare and specialized orchid, often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
